alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 12:50PM AKST until December 07 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to 5 inches along the coast and up to 11 inches inland. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From noon today to noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect periods of light snow this afternoon. A band of heavier snow will then form midday along the Inlet and Sterling highway corridor Anchor Point to Kenai. This band will move inland by this evening, with snow near the Inlet lightening up or even ending in some areas. The heaviest snow is expected east of Soldotna along the Sterling Highway from late this afternoon through Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
